Description: Pottery shabti of Djedmut with black painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face with traced eyes, crossed arms in relief holding two hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
